numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph shows percentages of young people.
2. These young people say that they reach out to their parents at least once a day or a few times a week.
3. The data is from an online survey.
4. The online survey surveyed 1495 young adults.
5. The young adults are 18 to 34 years old.
6. 75% of young women send texts to their parents at least once a day or a few times a week.
7. 50% of young men send texts to their parents at least once a day or a few times a week.
8. Young women send texts to their parents at a higher rate than young men do.
9. Young women phone their parents at a higher rate than young men do.
10. Young women video-chat with their parents at a higher rate than young men do.
11. Young women visit their parents in person at a higher rate than young men do.
12. I ask why this is the case.
13. It is possible that women are more family-oriented than men.
14. Visiting in person is rated as the lowest way to reach out to parents.
15. I ask whether social media and technology have ruined genuine face-to-face conversations.
16. It is possible that many people in the 18 to 34 age group live away from home.
17. If many people in the 18 to 34 age group live away from home then in-person visits are unattainable for these people.
18. This situation affects me and my community.
19. I have 2 older sisters.
20. One older sister lives away from home.
21. One older sister is in college.
22. My older sisters communicate with my parents by texts.
23. My older sisters communicate with my parents by phone calls.
24. Texts are easier than in-person visits for my older sisters.
25. Phone calls are easier than in-person visits for my older sisters.
26. The title is: Connecting with Loved Ones - "Kiss me through the phone?"
